Title: CBC-1071-T-CE Independent Mobility Assessments for Blue Badges                                       - AWARD
Description:
The Council is inviting tenders for the conduct of Independent Mobility Assessments (IMA's) to determine applicants' eligibility for the Blue Badge concessionary parking scheme. The aim of the service is to determine entitlement to Blue Badges.  The Service Provider will provide IMA's and make recommendations for eligibility against the statutory criteria and any local interpretations.
      
      Help and Support - The Council will provide as much support and information as it can in order to help guide you through the Tender process.  Questions asked together with the Council's response will be made available to all tenderers to ensure a fair and consistent approach to all. 
      
      If there is anything you are not sure of or need clarification on, please contact us using the Correspondence facility on the In-tend portal. Last date for receiving questions on the In-Tend system: 1st November 2019
      
      Return of Tender - Completed Tenders and attachments should be submitted electronically, by the due date via our "In-tend" electronic tendering system. Tenders must be uploaded via the "My Return" section of the system. Tenders submitted through the correspondence facility will not be considered. Your Tender must be submitted via the In-Tend system by no later than 12:00 noon on 8th November 2019. Tenders received after that time will be excluded.

Title: Adult Frailty and Long Term Conditions Assessments and Reviews
Description: The provider will undertake independent moving and handling reviews of current Adult Care Occupational Therapy Customers' needs. This will ensure that individuals remain safe and that they receive the appropriate level of service to best meet needs. Where required, the provider will also carry out re-assessments and support planning (moving and handling plan) according to service user need.                                                                                                                                                                                                          There are a maximum of 400 clients to be reviewed within the timeframe of this contract which will expire on 31st March 2020.  All activity must be completed by 31st March 2020.

Title: Occupational Health assessment support for Blue Badge and Concessionary Travel Services
Description:
Currently the Herefordshire Council has 8994 Blue Badges on issue within the County and receives on average 3500 applications per annum.  The Council also has 1753 Disabled Concessionary travel passes on issue within the County and issues on average 25 passes each month.

To support the delivery of the Blue Badge Parking Scheme and the Concessionary Travel Bus Pass scheme, the council seeks support from organisations that are able to provide an independent mobility assessment service, adhering to various professional standards.

Title: Social Care Assessment Service
Description:
Nottinghamshire County Council (the “Council”) is seeking to establish a framework agreement of suitably qualified service providers to supplement the Councils in house social work teams.
The Councils social work teams undertake assessments and reviews of service user’s needs. The Council is seeking to improve performance in this area through the appointment of a framework of providers who recruit and assign qualified social workers to undertake assessments and reviews passed to them via the Council within the target timescale.
In the future the contract may be varied to include Best Interest Assessments and Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards.

Title: Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards Assessments
Description:
Barnet Council has legal duties as part of the Mental Capacity Act Deprivation of Liberty Safeguards (DoLS). These safeguards exist to protect people in care homes and hospitals.
Where a deprivation is identified the provider must apply to the Local Authority for authorisation.
The Council developed an approved list of suppliers in April 2016, the Council  re-opened this approved list for new applicants to apply for the remaining duration of the approved list (2020).

Title: Care Act Information & Advice (Care Act Helpline)
Description:
Information and advice service on the Care Act via a dedicated helpline, including the types of care and support available, choice of providers, how to access care and support, how to access independent financial advice, support individuals to understand the financial implications of the Care Act and how to raise concerns about the safety or wellbeing of an adult who has care and support needs. See below for contract outcomes;

•	Ensure individuals are aware of the types of care and support available to them
•	Ensure individuals know how to access care and support
•	Ensure individuals know how to access information on independent financial advice
•	Ensure individuals know where to raised concerns of an adult with care and support needs.
•	Provide training and awareness  on the Care Act

Title: Domestic Abuse and Sexual Violence Electronic Case Management System
Description:
Cornwall & Isles of Scilly (CIOS) Community Domestic Abuse and Sexual Violence Electronic Case Management System (DASV ECMS). 
Cornwall and the Isles of Scilly (CIoS) are looking to procure a web based electronic case management system to facilitate coordination of packages of support for those affected by domestic abuse and sexual violence. In CIOS domestic abuse and sexual violence services will be delivered across multiple office sites. 
The service provision that the ECMS will need to support is: 
•	A single point of access 
•	Independent Domestic Violence Advisor service. 
•	Refuge provision
•	Recovery and therapeutic interventions
The ECMS will need to go live on the 13th August, with a robust implementation period prior to this. For further information and in order to respond to this tender opportunity go to: www.supplyingthesouthwest.org.uk (Due North)
